docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Sept. 29 -- The possibility of a close race between Argentina and Uruguay for election to the United Nations Security Council developed tonight. Although the Latin - American countries, together with the United States and Great...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Sept. 29 -- The possibility of a close race between Argentina and Uruguay for election to the United Nations Security Council developed tonight. Although the Latin - American countries, together with the United States and Great Britain, are committed to Argentina, it was understood that Sweden, Norway, Denmark, the Soviet Union and countries in the Soviet bloc might vote for Uruguay.

headline.main: 2 LATIN COUNTRIES MAY BE IN U.N. RACE; Argentina and Uruguay May Contest Security Body Seat --Nordic Group a Factor

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The responsibility of building up the supply of the world's fine wools lies with Australia and the United States, it was asserted yesterday by members of the International Wool Secretariat meeting in New York. They estimated that it would take a...
docs.lead_paragraph: The responsibility of building up the supply of the world's fine wools lies with Australia and the United States, it was asserted yesterday by members of the International Wool Secretariat meeting in New York. They estimated that it would take a minimum of three years to build up sneep population to a point where production will fall into line with current consumption of better grades of wool.
docs.abstract: WORLD: Internatl Wool Secretariat wool promotion plan discussed

headline.main: FINE WOOLS PUT UP TO U.S., AUSTRALIA; Propagation of Sheep to Meet Demand, Says Secretariat, Will Take Three Years

docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly, after electing Argentina and Canada to the Security Council by overwhelming majorities, plunged into a deadlock yesterday on the choice of a successor to Poland.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly, after electing Argentina and Canada to the Security Council by overwhelming majorities, plunged into a deadlock yesterday on the choice of a successor to Poland.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 1 -- Latin-American countries are expected to contribute $20,000,000 to the Children's Emergency Fund and virtually assure that the relief organization will obtain its full monetary goal, officials of the Fund predicted...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 1 -- Latin-American countries are expected to contribute $20,000,000 to the Children's Emergency Fund and virtually assure that the relief organization will obtain its full monetary goal, officials of the Fund predicted today.

docs.snippet: There was a firm undertone and a good turnover last week in the pound sterling, and the free currencies of Canada and Switzerland, the three foreign exchanges which have been the principals of recent market interest. In other sections business was...
docs.lead_paragraph: There was a firm undertone and a good turnover last week in the pound sterling, and the free currencies of Canada and Switzerland, the three foreign exchanges which have been the principals of recent market interest. In other sections business was only fair and rates were maintained at prevailing levels.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 6 -- Spokesmen for two Latin-American countries, Panama and Uruguay, in statements before the United Nations Special Committee ion Palestine here today, favored the partition of Palestine, but the representatives of a leading...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 6 -- Spokesmen for two Latin-American countries, Panama and Uruguay, in statements before the United Nations Special Committee ion Palestine here today, favored the partition of Palestine, but the representatives of a leading Arab country, Iraq, violently opposed it.

docs.lead_paragraph: YESTERDAY'S EVENTS General Assembly Committee 1 (Political and Security) -- Heard Andrei Y. Vishinsky, Soviet representative, call for a rejection of the United States resolution on the Greek question and for immediate withdrawal of foreign troops and missions from Greece.
